text: Number 85, Association of Data Processing Service Organizations against Camp.
Mr. Chief Justice and may it please the Court.
They might have had it without that regulation.
If they have --
Let’s assume that it just started out doing it.
If they have authority under the acts of Congress Your Honor, they would not need the specific authorization.
So the question is the statutes?
That’s correct, the question is statutory authority.
Under your view of the standing issue, would you, would be not reach the merits namely the question of the authority that comptroller to authorize?
No Your Honor, not in this situation.
A case should go back to the Court of Appeals.
A case would go back for trial.
What bearing do you think the Flast case has?
Your Honor, I feel that Flast v. Cohen shows a philosophy of standing that would grant standing in this case.
Well, suppose there are some trial cases of the court that would have been decided differently under your theory?
Not under the narrow scope of statutory aid to standing Your Honor under the broad --
You mean they -- we must -- for you to win, must we buy the bank service corporation approach?
No, we have two basic issues Your Honor.
You’re saying that it isn’t enough for standing just to show an economic injury?
I think it is if you overrule about three to four cases of this Court.
Are you urging that we do that?
Yes, Your Honor and in our brief we have set forth that rather extensively.
But accepting those cases, you still think you have pending in this case?
Yes, following Tennessee Electric Power, we think we have standing under the doctrine of statutory aid to standing.
When the statutory aid is under the bank service corporation?
That is correct.
That’s the only source?
That’s the only statute we rely on, Your Honor.
Mr. Chief Justice and may it please the Court.
Thank you.
There you’re getting at the merits, aren’t you?
No, Senator Bush is saying that again that we should not authorize banks to go into competition.
Thank you Mr. Gross, thank you Mr. Rosenthal for your submissions.
